thread.title: Sports digest: Escort asks, how could Pitino not know?
thread.title_full: Sports digest: Escort asks, how could Pitino not know?

author: Associated Press
title: Sports digest: Escort asks, how could Pitino not know?
text:
Sports digest: Escort asks, how could Pitino not know? Associated Press Posted: 10/20/2015 08:30:37 PM PDT Updated: 10/20/2015 08:54:29 PM PDT Escort Katina Powell broke her silence on Tuesday, saying she has no proof that Louisville men's basketball coach Rick Pitino knew that a former Cardinals staffer hired her and other dancers to strip and have sex with former recruits and players. 
But Powell said in an interview initially aired on ABC's "Good Morning America" that with "a boatload" of recruits and dancers, "loud music, alcohol, security, cameras" in a campus dormitory, "how could Rick not know?" 
In her first interview since the release of her book earlier this month, "Breaking Cardinal Rules: Basketball and the Escort Queen," Powell spoke with ESPN's "Outside the Lines," part of which was aired on the ABC morning show and all day on the sports network. Powell said that the coach had to be aware of some of 22 shows she alleges that former staffer Andre McGee paid her for that took place from 2010-14. 
Pitino has denied knowledge of the activities that Powell alleges in her book. Pitino told Yahoo Sports on Tuesday: "There's only one person who can speak on this matter, and that's Andre McGee. He owes it to his teammates, coaches and the university to tell the truth. The truth has got to come out, and not just to the NCAA." Golf Tiger Woods has not started rehabilitation for a second back surgery he had a month ago, and he said he would face another "tedious and long" process that suggests it might be awhile before he competes again. Woods last played at the Wyndham Champion on Aug. 23. Advertisement 
"Rehab will be soon, and it will be tedious and long," Woods said at the Bridgestone America's Golf Cup in Mexico City, an exhibition he was supposed to play with Matt Kuchar until the second surgery. "Some players on tour have done the same procedure, and to be back pain-free, it took them over a year." 
The British Open is heading across the Irish Sea for the first time in nearly 70 years, with Royal Portrush in Northern Ireland announced as the 2019 venue for golf's oldest major championship. Royal Portrush staged the British Open in 1951, the only time the event has been held outside England or Scotland. 
Organizers say PGA Tour Player of the Year Jordan Spieth will headline the Singapore Open in January when the tournament returns after a three-year absence. Miscellany New Orleans Pelicans guard Tyreke Evans underwent arthroscopic surgery on his right knee. The Pelicans did not provide a timetable for Evans' return. 
Ohio State coach Urban Meyer said quarterback J.T. Barrett will replace Cardale Jones as the starter when the No. 1 Buckeyes play at Rutgers on Saturday. Barrett accounted for four touchdowns in relief of Jones in a 38-10 victory against Penn State last weekend. 
Lamar Odom left a Las Vegas hospital and is now in the Los Angeles area to continue his recovery a week after he was found unconscious at a Nevada brothel, a family representative said. 
The former NBA player was transported by helicopter from Sunrise Hospital and Medical Center in Las Vegas around 5 p.m. Monday, according to a statement from Alvina Alston, publicist for Odom's aunt JaNean Mercer. She did not say where he was taken in Los Angeles. 
"He continues to make miraculous progress, taking a few steps in Los Angeles," the statement said.
